It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.</feedburner:browserFriendly><item><title>Solar Impulse Has Made It to Tulsa</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/Lsr9toF33MQ/solar-impulse-has-made-it-to-tulsa-1776426011</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--tILao2nN--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/jwnrrhqkrcogvhwa0xuf.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Solar Impulse has chalked up another 1,000 miles in its bid to circumnavigate the globe. The all-electric solar-powered airplane successfully flew from Phoenix to Tulsa, landing in the dead of night.</p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/solar-impulse-has-made-it-to-tulsa-1776426011">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/Lsr9toF33MQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">solar impulse</category><category domain="">airplanes</category><category domain="">solar</category><category domain="">energy</category><category domain="">engineering</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:26:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776426011</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Jamie Condliffe]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/solar-impulse-has-made-it-to-tulsa-1776426011</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Apple Just Took Its First Big Step Into The Automotive Industry</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/qkXMoz8nc_w/did-apple-just-take-its-first-big-step-into-the-automot-1776407462</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--0F3I081c--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/tgm1sys0yn1dsgvcl8bo.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Apple announced an investment of $1 billion in China’s largest private ride-hailing service company Didi Chuxing in a move intended to not only better understand the Chinese market, but to finally take the big step into the transportation industry <a href="http://jalopnik.com/apples-r-d-spending-could-suggest-a-pivot-towards-trans-1776202275#_ga=1.225389336.3220625.1445922072">we’ve been expecting</a>.<br /></p><p><a href="http://jalopnik.com/did-apple-just-take-its-first-big-step-into-the-automot-1776407462">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/qkXMoz8nc_w" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">apple car</category><category domain="">didi chuxing</category><category domain="">apple</category><category domain="">project titan</category><category domain="">uber</category><category domain="">lyft</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:29:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776407462</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Justin Westbrook on Jalopnik, shared by Jamie Condliffe to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://jalopnik.com/did-apple-just-take-its-first-big-step-into-the-automot-1776407462</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Facebook Admits Its Trending Section Includes Topics Not Actually Trending on Facebook [Update: Zuck Speaks]</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/yi6Cpw-bUBg/facebook-admits-its-trending-section-includes-topics-no-1776319308</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--ADtPRTYe--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/se74vcw8yqvaangswzbz.jpg" /><p class="first-text"><em>This story was originally published at 6:35 p.m. EST. It has been updated to add Mark Zuckerberg’s comments.</em></p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/facebook-admits-its-trending-section-includes-topics-no-1776319308">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/yi6Cpw-bUBg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">facebook</category><category domain="">trending</category><category domain="">news</category><category domain="">leaked</category><category domain="">documents</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:22:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776319308</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Michael Nunez]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/facebook-admits-its-trending-section-includes-topics-no-1776319308</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Neat Art Piece Hides Two Different Wire Sculptures Depending on Your Perspective</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/wZ9oxhxIO5Y/neat-art-piece-hides-two-different-wire-sculptures-depe-1776384815</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--TnyWT0cN--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/pfnco9doyihakldtrp1h.gif" /><figure class="has-media media-medium has-image">
 <img src="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--PVU5TbM1--/pfnco9doyihakldtrp1h.gif" width="636" height="358" alt="Neat Art Piece Hides Two Different Wire Sculptures Depending on Your Perspective" lazyload="true" data-chomp-id="pfnco9doyihakldtrp1h" data-asset-url="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--PVU5TbM1--/pfnco9doyihakldtrp1h.gif" data-format="gif" firstasset="true" />
</figure>
<p class="first-text">Here’s a fun art piece made by artist <a href="http://cargocollective.com/matthieu-robert-ortis/En-video" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Matthieu Robert-Ortis</a>: in one perspective, it looks like two giraffes standing opposite each other while in another, it looks like a single elephant staring straight at you. The piece plays on your perspective and hides two wire sculptures in one, what you see depends on which angle you’re looking at it.</p><p><a href="http://sploid.gizmodo.com/neat-art-piece-hides-two-different-wire-sculptures-depe-1776384815">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/wZ9oxhxIO5Y" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">art</category><category domain="">sculptures</category><category domain="">animals</category><category domain="">perspective</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:41:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776384815</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Casey Chan on Sploid, shared by Cheryl Eddy to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://sploid.gizmodo.com/neat-art-piece-hides-two-different-wire-sculptures-depe-1776384815</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>How Toyota Land Cruisers Are Being Turned Into Mobile Cell Towers</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/psul0owLn5c/how-working-land-cruisers-are-turned-into-cell-towers-1776143744</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--yzZz79Ns--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/qpdifyoh5vreaeseemhf.gif" /><p class="first-text">Australia is a beautiful, vast country with hardly anybody living it. That’s why some 70 percent of the landmass has no cell coverage. But there are still enough people around to try and come up with a creative strategy for backcountry communication.<br /></p><p><a href="http://truckyeah.jalopnik.com/how-working-land-cruisers-are-turned-into-cell-towers-1776143744">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/psul0owLn5c" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">australia</category><category domain="">off-road</category><category domain="">toyota land cruiser</category><category domain="">suvs</category><category domain="">4x4</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:30:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776143744</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Andrew P Collins on Truck Yeah, shared by Cheryl Eddy to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://truckyeah.jalopnik.com/how-working-land-cruisers-are-turned-into-cell-towers-1776143744</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Interesting Portrait of an Actor Who Plays Monsters in Movies</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/sInWP-t2wMA/interesting-portrait-of-an-actor-who-plays-monsters-in-1776170134</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--UspF0rMc--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/ifcpuurujhvihuop6tnn.gif" /><figure class="has-media media-medium has-image">
 <img src="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--8YrqWrQ7--/ifcpuurujhvihuop6tnn.gif" width="640" height="310" alt="Interesting Portrait of an Actor Who Plays Monsters in Movies" lazyload="true" data-chomp-id="ifcpuurujhvihuop6tnn" data-asset-url="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--8YrqWrQ7--/ifcpuurujhvihuop6tnn.gif" data-format="gif" firstasset="true" />
</figure>
<p class="first-text">Meet Tom Woodruff. You’ve seen him in movies but probably didn’t even realize he was in them because he specializes in playing creatures. That is, he’s been the alien in <em>Aliens, </em>a gorilla in various TV shows and movies, done work for <em>Jumanji</em>, and so much more. What’s cool is to hear him talk about his craft and process and to see him act it out in an actual suit versus doing motion capture (not that there’s anything wrong with that). </p><p><a href="http://sploid.gizmodo.com/interesting-portrait-of-an-actor-who-plays-monsters-in-1776170134">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/sInWP-t2wMA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">neat</category><category domain="">monsters</category><category domain="">movies</category><category domain="">actors</category><category domain="">acting</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 02:34:51 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776170134</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Casey Chan on Sploid, shared by Cheryl Eddy to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://sploid.gizmodo.com/interesting-portrait-of-an-actor-who-plays-monsters-in-1776170134</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Watch a Spear Get Forged Using Centuries-Old Methods</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/pPsVkHTAlOE/watch-a-spear-get-forged-using-century-old-methods-1776296378</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--n5Cu2eKT--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/fi0n2sqshrtj4vlbg4tb.gif" /><figure class="has-media media-medium has-image">
 <img src="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Er5RaBQb--/fi0n2sqshrtj4vlbg4tb.gif" width="640" height="290" alt="Watch a Spear Get Forged Using Centuries-Old Methods" lazyload="true" data-chomp-id="fi0n2sqshrtj4vlbg4tb" data-asset-url="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Er5RaBQb--/fi0n2sqshrtj4vlbg4tb.gif" data-format="gif" firstasset="true" />
</figure>
<p class="first-text">To make a spearhead like a Norman smith from the year 1066, you have to start with an iron steel sandwich. Yup, a piece of hard iron or steel gets sandwiched between two pieces of soft iron until they’re all hammered and welded together. After that, a socket needs to be made, which means the smith flattens out the metal wide enough so it can be folded into a circle to stick a wooden shaft in.</p><p><a href="http://sploid.gizmodo.com/watch-a-spear-get-forged-using-century-old-methods-1776296378">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/pPsVkHTAlOE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">neat</category><category domain="">forging</category><category domain="">metal</category><category domain="">weapons</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:30:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776296378</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Casey Chan on Sploid, shared by Cheryl Eddy to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://sploid.gizmodo.com/watch-a-spear-get-forged-using-century-old-methods-1776296378</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>ABC Has Canceled Marvel's Agent Carter</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/sKTVR_qw07o/abc-has-cancelled-marvels-agent-carter-1776366639</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--cYJg6COB--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/na33llejpvn8y1xnquds.jpg" /><p class="first-text">After two seasons of fighting crime, <em>Agent Carter</em> has been given her walking papers. The ABC show, based on a character from the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has been canceled.</p><p><a href="http://io9.gizmodo.com/abc-has-cancelled-marvels-agent-carter-1776366639">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/sKTVR_qw07o" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">agent carter</category><category domain="">hayley atwell</category><category domain="">television</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:49:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776366639</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Germain Lussier on io9, shared by Cheryl Eddy to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://io9.gizmodo.com/abc-has-cancelled-marvels-agent-carter-1776366639</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>A Terrifying Interactive Map Visualizes the Devastation of Nuclear Fallout</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/xZMuQjqMG7s/a-terrifying-interactive-map-visualizes-the-devastation-1776357375</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--7qsQ1qdb--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/fncfexcxmijxiuxappk2.jpg" /><p class="first-text">The destructive power of nuclear bombs has been seared into our collective memory, thanks to archival images of the devastation of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. There’s the blast itself, and then all the radioactive fallout to contend with. A new interactive map shows what the damage from fallout would be if nuclear bombs were dropped on target cities today.</p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/a-terrifying-interactive-map-visualizes-the-devastation-1776357375">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/xZMuQjqMG7s" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">nuclear weapons</category><category domain="">fallout</category><category domain="">science</category><category domain="">physics</category><category domain="">nukemap</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:40:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776357375</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Jennifer Ouellette]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/a-terrifying-interactive-map-visualizes-the-devastation-1776357375</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>It's Official: Season Two of Supergirl Will Be on the CW</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/mPhlL60eA78/its-official-season-two-of-supergirl-will-be-on-the-cw-1776348480</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--pjwHC36y--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/afvo6bwbne6pwkmd3wnq.jpg" /><figure class="has-media media-medium has-image">
 <img src="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--lDGh8Fro--/afvo6bwbne6pwkmd3wnq.jpg" width="779" height="451" alt="It's Official: Season Two of Supergirl&nbsp;Will Be on the CW" lazyload="true" data-chomp-id="afvo6bwbne6pwkmd3wnq" data-asset-url="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--lDGh8Fro--/afvo6bwbne6pwkmd3wnq.jpg" data-format="jpg" firstasset="true" />
 <figcaption>
  Image: Supergirl, CBS/WB
 </figcaption>
</figure>
<p class="first-text">As has been<a href="http://io9.gizmodo.com/to-get-renewed-supergirl-might-slash-its-budget-and-mo-1774870765"> rumored</a>
 <inset id="1774870765" /> for a while, <em>Supergirl </em>will get a second season. But it will move from CBS to the CW.<br /></p><p><a href="http://io9.gizmodo.com/its-official-season-two-of-supergirl-will-be-on-the-cw-1776348480">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/mPhlL60eA78" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">supergirl</category><category domain="">cw</category><category domain="">cbs</category><category domain="">television</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:20:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776348480</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Katharine Trendacosta on io9, shared by Cheryl Eddy to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://io9.gizmodo.com/its-official-season-two-of-supergirl-will-be-on-the-cw-1776348480</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Today's Best Deals: Free Channels, Pyrex Dishes, Bluetooth Headphones, and More</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/_JTL0n4qc-g/todays-best-deals-free-hdtv-pyrex-dishes-bluetooth-h-1776234799</link><description><img href="http://www.amazon.com/AmazonBasics-Ultra-Thin-Indoor-Antenna/dp/B00X4RAEZC/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">amplified HDTV antenna</a>, <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Pyrex-8-Piece-Glass-Bakeware-Storage/dp/B004CFY55A?kinja_price=15" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Pyrex dishes</a>, and a <a href="http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00Q2B5KY2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">clever USB battery pack</a> lead off Thursday’s best deals.</p><p><a href="http://deals.kinja.com/todays-best-deals-free-hdtv-pyrex-dishes-bluetooth-h-1776234799">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/_JTL0n4qc-g" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">kinja deals</category><category domain="">deals</category><category domain="">daily deals</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:56:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776234799</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Shep McAllister on Deals, shared by Shep McAllister to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deals.kinja.com/todays-best-deals-free-hdtv-pyrex-dishes-bluetooth-h-1776234799</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Just Four Minutes of Matthew McConaughey Making Weird Noises</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/e8LM6E_FyxU/just-four-minutes-of-matthew-mcconaughey-making-weird-n-1776342095</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--d93S8Ka9--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/xmahsf2rh2wnjvvg7ion.gif" /><p class="first-text">The same folks who realized Owen Wilson is <a href="http://sploid.gizmodo.com/video-all-the-times-owen-wilson-has-said-wow-in-movies-1703678308">contractually obligated to say “wow” in every film</a>
 <inset id="1703678308" /> have stumbled upon something truly strange: Matthew McConaughey makes a lot of noises. Noises that are not words. Noises that do not convey almost any information other than “I am Matthew McConaughey and my mouth can make this sound.”</p><p><a href="http://sploid.gizmodo.com/just-four-minutes-of-matthew-mcconaughey-making-weird-n-1776342095">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/e8LM6E_FyxU" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">grawwwwww</category><category domain="">matthew mcconaughey</category><category domain="">movies</category><category domain="">actors</category><category domain="">alright alright alright</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:10:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776342095</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Bryan Menegus on Sploid, shared by Cheryl Eddy to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://sploid.gizmodo.com/just-four-minutes-of-matthew-mcconaughey-making-weird-n-1776342095</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Truck Yeah Your Next Pickup Truck Will Be A Car | Two Cents Why Walmart Is Suing Visa, and What It M</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/re9mwcCBm94/truck-yeah-your-next-pickup-truck-will-be-a-car-two-c-1776347196</link><description><p class="first-text"><strong>Truck Yeah</strong> <a href="http://truckyeah.jalopnik.com/your-next-pickup-truck-will-be-a-car-1776145082?utm_source=recirculation&amp;utm_medium=recirculation&amp;utm_campaign=thursdayPM" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Your Next Pickup Truck Will Be A Car</a>
 <inset id="1776145082" /> | <strong>Two Cents</strong> <a href="http://twocents.lifehacker.com/why-walmart-is-suing-visa-and-what-it-means-for-your-c-1776087900?utm_source=recirculation&amp;utm_medium=recirculation&amp;utm_campaign=thursdayPM" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Why Walmart Is Suing Visa, and What It Means for Your Credit Cards</a>
 <inset id="1776087900" /> | <strong>io9</strong> <a href="http://io9.gizmodo.com/youre-not-doing-the-time-warp-its-just-the-new-rocky-h-1776275600?utm_source=recirculation&amp;utm_medium=recirculation&amp;utm_campaign=thursdayPM" rel="noopener" target="_blank">You’re Not Doing the Time Warp, It’s Just the New <em>Rocky Horror Picture Show</em> </a>
 <inset id="1776275600" /> | <strong>Kotaku</strong> <a href="http://kotaku.com/lets-talk-about-that-one-scene-in-uncharted-4-1776324764?utm_source=recirculation&amp;utm_medium=recirculation&amp;utm_campaign=thursdayPM" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Let’s Talk About That One Scene In <em>Uncharted 4</em></a>
 <inset id="1776324764" /> |</p><p><a href="http://kinjaroundup.kinja.com/truck-yeah-your-next-pickup-truck-will-be-a-car-two-c-1776347196">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/re9mwcCBm94" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">evening favorites</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:14:34 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776347196</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Kinja! on Kinja Roundup, shared by Cheryl Eddy to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kinjaroundup.kinja.com/truck-yeah-your-next-pickup-truck-will-be-a-car-two-c-1776347196</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Philadelphia Police Now Investigating Its Own Fake Google Maps Car</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/W_Untar7xfE/philadelphia-police-now-investigating-its-own-fake-goog-1776345190</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--paiTzSs5--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/tou4i64ijwapxdpigvps.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Yesterday we told you about the suspicious SUV in Pennsylvania that had a license plate reader mounted on the front and a Google Maps <a href="http://gizmodo.com/is-this-a-police-suv-disguised-as-a-google-street-view-1776016317">sticker on the side</a>
 <inset id="1776016317" />. The Pennsylvania State Police told us that it wasn’t their vehicle, despite the fact that it had a PSP placard in the window. We now know that it was actually the city of <a href="https://motherboard.vice.com/read/philly-police-admit-they-disguised-a-spy-truck-as-a-google-streetview-car" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Philadelphia’s SUV</a>.<br /></p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/philadelphia-police-now-investigating-its-own-fake-goog-1776345190">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/W_Untar7xfE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">fake google maps suv</category><category domain="">bad surveillance</category><category domain="">surveillance</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:20:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776345190</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Matt Novak]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/philadelphia-police-now-investigating-its-own-fake-goog-1776345190</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Hubble Just Caught a Close-Up View of What Flying Into an Active Comet Looks Like</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/i1ivSf6LmIg/hubble-just-caught-a-close-up-view-of-what-flying-into-1776343521</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--eLTUp3mu--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/tcig19kbpnmdamhm9n2l.gif" /><p class="first-text">Comets brush by us all the time, but they’re usually not close enough for us to catch anything more than a glimpse as they streak through the sky. But, thanks to one very close comet, Hubble just got an incredible insider view.</p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/hubble-just-caught-a-close-up-view-of-what-flying-into-1776343521">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/i1ivSf6LmIg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">space</category><category domain="">comets</category><category domain="">science</category><category domain="">nasa</category><category domain="">meteor shower</category><category domain="">meteors</category><category domain="">comet 252p</category><category domain="">comet linear</category><category domain="">comet 252plinear</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:05:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776343521</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Ria Misra]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/hubble-just-caught-a-close-up-view-of-what-flying-into-1776343521</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>The Art of Making Impossibly Thin Gold Leaves from a Tiny Piece of Gold</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/bv1Vq6CQIzk/the-art-of-making-an-impossibly-thin-gold-leaf-from-a-t-1776331400</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Cl4sC9eP--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/qwfyttcdooyudmdyaexf.gif" /><figure class="has-media media-medium has-image">
 <img src="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Fgoo-XWG--/qwfyttcdooyudmdyaexf.gif" width="640" height="283" alt="The Art of Making Impossibly Thin Gold Leaves from a Tiny Piece of Gold" lazyload="true" data-chomp-id="qwfyttcdooyudmdyaexf" data-asset-url="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Fgoo-XWG--/qwfyttcdooyudmdyaexf.gif" data-format="gif" firstasset="true" />
</figure>
<p class="first-text">Gold is so malleable that a single gram of it can be stretched into a strip nearly two miles long. A tiny little coin can be pressed into a 0.0001-millimeter-thin golden rectangular sheet the size of a tatami mat. So leave it to the talented artisans of Japan to transform a tiny bit of gold into shimmering gold leaf that’s so thin, it’s almost translucent. </p><p><a href="http://sploid.gizmodo.com/the-art-of-making-an-impossibly-thin-gold-leaf-from-a-t-1776331400">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/bv1Vq6CQIzk" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">neat</category><category domain="">gold</category><category domain="">metal</category><category domain="">paper</category><category domain="">japan</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:20:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776331400</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Casey Chan on Sploid, shared by Adam Clark Estes to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://sploid.gizmodo.com/the-art-of-making-an-impossibly-thin-gold-leaf-from-a-t-1776331400</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>MIT Wants You to Swallow This Origami Robot Pill to Retrieve Other Crap You've Swallowed</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/6GINGTkg1t0/mit-wants-you-to-swallow-this-origami-robot-pill-to-ret-1776329221</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--ShrCjuQi--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/oz4g2fl9pyuhly5carur.gif" /><p class="first-text">According to MIT, Americans swallow over 3,500 button-sized batteries every year. Say what? But instead of educating the public about <em>not</em> swallowing random crap, researchers at the school want people to swallow a new <a href="http://news.mit.edu/2016/ingestible-origami-robot-0512" rel="noopener" target="_blank">folding origami robot they’ve developed</a> that’s designed to retrieve foreign objects, among other tasks.<br /></p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/mit-wants-you-to-swallow-this-origami-robot-pill-to-ret-1776329221">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/6GINGTkg1t0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">robots</category><category domain="">mit</category><category domain="">research</category><category domain="">pills</category><category domain="">medical</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:18:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776329221</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Andrew Liszewski]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/mit-wants-you-to-swallow-this-origami-robot-pill-to-ret-1776329221</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>The Fallout 4 Survival Permadeath Run That Turned Preston Garvey Into A Monster</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/9n-0HpWLPew/the-fallout-4-survival-permadeath-run-that-turned-prest-1776289180</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--czI8PwIL--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/yqyl3jany6vud8nkth6q.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Most players attempting <em>Fallout 4’</em>s Survival mode will just get their ass kicked. One player, however, has already managed to beat the entire thing on a single life. Funnily enough, the toughest challenge Kyle Hinckley faced along the way wasn’t something like starvation or damage, but rather a nearly catastrophic glitch.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/the-fallout-4-survival-permadeath-run-that-turned-prest-1776289180">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/9n-0HpWLPew" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">fallout</category><category domain="">fallout 4</category><category domain="">bethesda</category><category domain="">permadeath</category><category domain="">watch this</category><category domain="">youtube</category><category domain="">kotaku core</category><category domain="">editors picks</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:00:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776289180</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patricia Hernandez on Kotaku, shared by Mario Aguilar to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/the-fallout-4-survival-permadeath-run-that-turned-prest-1776289180</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>That Excellent Simpsons Quote Search Engine Now Makes Gifs as Well</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/HHR3bWB73QY/that-excellent-simpsons-quote-search-engine-now-makes-g-1776331156</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--hnQN8SZs--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/bs0ntifuukkkpo6bdysj.gif" /><p class="first-text"><a href="https://frinkiac.com/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Frinkiac</a>, the delightful timewaster that lets <em>Simpsons</em> fans <a href="http://io9.gizmodo.com/this-amazing-simpsons-search-engine-matches-the-perfect-1756956164#_ga=1.234573913.695105157.1461115217">search for their favorite quote and instantly find the matching screencap</a>, just got even better: now it lets you create gifs, too. But the people responsible for the rhythm of emotional arcs and intimate moments of conflict are rarely if acknowledged. Those people are film editors, and counterintuitively, an editor is often at their best when their work is totally invisible.</p><p><a href="http://sploid.gizmodo.com/how-patient-film-editing-lets-us-feel-luke-skywalkers-f-1776310193">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/dVYu1-n0Jeo" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">movies</category><category domain="">every frame a painting</category><category domain="">tony zhou</category><category domain="">editing</category><category domain="">film</category><category domain="">star wars</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:45:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776310193</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Bryan Menegus on Sploid, shared by Adam Clark Estes to Gizmodo]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://sploid.gizmodo.com/how-patient-film-editing-lets-us-feel-luke-skywalkers-f-1776310193</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>How To Cook A Delicious Meal With Your Car</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/3KM4sZYSHng/how-to-cook-a-delicious-meal-with-your-car-1775720726</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--xbDJvF7F--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/xkx8x2qfpbrwg0hwky54.png" /><p class="first-text">Your car’s gasoline engine wastes two thirds of its fuel’s energy as heat, so why not harness that energy and cook a delicious meal? At least 15 medal winners were reportedly involved. </p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/report-russia-ran-a-state-run-doping-program-for-2014-1776309774">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~4/Xz8fCTa7eEY" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">drugs</category><category domain="">sochi</category><category domain="">olympics</category><category domain="">sports</category><category domain="">doping</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:05:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776309774</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Darren Orf]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/report-russia-ran-a-state-run-doping-program-for-2014-1776309774</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Don’t forget: You can email us tips at tipbox@gizmodo.com, send them directly to any of our writers,</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/gizmodo/full/~3/5mgPszNH2Ks/don-t-forget-you-can-email-us-tips-at-tips-gawker-com-1763615386</link><description><p class="first-text">Don’t forget: You can email us tips at <a href="mailto: tipbox@gizmodo.com">tipbox@gizmodo.com</a>, send them directly to <a href="http://gizmodo.com/about">any of our writers</a>, or use our anonymous <a href="https://gawkermediagroup.com/securedrop/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">SecureDrop system</a>.
